item.title: 6 Resident Evil Games With Barely Any Puzzles
item.description:
Summary

  • Resident Evil games vary in puzzle content, with some, like RE3 Remake, being streamlined for quicker play.
  • Resident Evil 5 focuses on fast-paced action with minimal puzzles, appealing to co-op gameplay.
  • The Chronicles games provide entry points to the series without puzzles, focusing on gameplay and story.

Puzzles have long been somewhat of a tradition in the Resident Evil franchise, with most games in the series featuring at least a few brainteasers or riddles to add some diversity to the core gameplay loop. However, everyone has their own opinions on what does and does not work in a Resident Evil game, whether that be the camera angles, the focus on action or horror, or the puzzles - more specifically, how many of them should be in a game.

There are a lot of fans out there who simply don't enjoy puzzles slowing down the pace of the gameplay, and having an abundance of difficult puzzles can also be a little intimidating to newcomers. The good news is that anyone who simply wants a game that they can run through and enjoy without having to rack their brain along the way will find a lot to love with this series, as there have been more than a few Resident Evil games that feature barely any puzzle . Some even have none.

6 Resident Evil 3 Remake

The Remake Of Resident Evil 3 Streamlined Jill's Journey While Also Making It A Little Shorter

While the remake of Resident Evil 2 felt like a fleshed-out and expanded version of the original, it seems Capcom had a slightly different philosophy in mind when reimagining the classic third entry. This time around, the remake was a lot more streamlined, with entire areas, such as the clock tower, being entirely removed. The same approach was also taken with several puzzles.

Though there is an early train puzzle, alongside a small vaccine riddle later in the story, players won't need to worry all that much about getting stuck on any difficult challenges during their desperate escape from Raccoon City. If anything, the lack of puzzles has actually been a major benefit of Resident Evil 3 Remake , as the game has come to be appreciated as a short but sweet experience that can be finished in a single day thanks to how streamlined it is.

5 Resident Evil 5

Resident Evil 5 Leaves Puzzles Behind To Provide A Fast-Paced Co-Op Shooter Experience

Resident Evil 5 is often touted as one of the best co-op horror games ever made, and a major reason why it's so much fun to play with a buddy is because the game never lets its foot off the gas. Chris and Sheva are constantly entering new areas and being swarmed by hordes of ferocious Majini, meaning that puzzles are largely non-existent with this installment, but that's certainly not a bad thing.

There is one major puzzle near the halfway point where both players will need to rotate a set of light beams to open up a door. Outside of that, though, most of the game consists of simply picking up keys and blasting away the hordes of enemies who stand in Chris and Sheva's way, making it ideal for those who enjoy fast-paced action-packed shooters.

4 Resident Evil: Operation Raccoon City

Players Can Explore The Zombie-Infested Raccoon City Without Needing To Be Bogged Down By Puzzles

Operation Raccoon City is quite a unique entry in the series. Not only does it allow players to dive back into Raccoon City from a different character perspective, this time playing as Umbrella agents, but it is also the first game to feature a full 4-player co-op campaign. Having four players working together to solve a tricky puzzle can only really be done with a solid team who are all communicating with one another, but for a lobby of strangers, these areas probably wouldn't work quite as smoothly.

Therefore, the game ditches puzzles entirely to make sure that the story is always moving at a steady pace, keeping every member of the team engaged at all times. While Operation Raccoon City received much flak upon release, a lot of fans have started warming up to it over the years, especially those who enjoy jumping in for quick and breezy gameplay sessions.

3 Resident Evil: The Umbrella/Darkside Chronicles

The Chronicles Games Are Ideal Entry Points For Newcomers, Prioritizing Story And Gameplay Over Puzzle Solving

This applies to both Umbrella Chronicles and Darkside Chronicles , as both play exactly the same and are designed to cover the stories of previous games while also providing some brand-new lore for fans of the series to enjoy. Both games are traditional on-rails arcade shooters where the characters move on their own while players direct their reticle over the enemies, which, in this case, can take the form of a zombie, Tyrant, Hunter, giant spiders, and many other weird and grotesque monstrosities.

These two games are an absolute blast to play in co-op, especially for newcomers who want to get themselves up to speed on the series without needing to dig out the older titles. These games also manage to replicate the core elements of survival horror by packing in plenty of jump scares and only limited resources for players to get their hands on. What also adds to their accessibility is that they don't feature any puzzles, since it simply wouldn't work with this particular style of gameplay.

2 Resident Evil 6

With Such A Heavy Focus On Action, Resident Evil 6 Didn't Have Much Room For Brain Teasers

With Resident Evil 6 , Capcom had the idea of creating multiple campaigns that all fed into different genres. Leon's campaign was supposed to be the one that was most identical to the series' early survival horror roots, making for a much slower and more methodical playthrough, at least at the beginning. While the catacombs do contain a puzzle here and there, once Leon and Helena escape and become part of the wider plot, the campaign essentially becomes one giant action-fest, with QTE prompts replacing the puzzles entirely.

Jake and Chris' campaigns are also very light on the puzzles, focusing a lot more on action set-pieces and bombastic boss fights. Ada's campaign does have a few head-scratchers thrown in for good measure, but her story is quite short in comparison to the others. Still, the satisfying melee combat and incredible Mercenaries mode ensures that fans of action will still adore what Resident Evil 6 has to offer.

1 Resident Evil 4

Leon's Epic Journey To Rescue Ashley Features Plenty Of Ganados, A Few Invisible Bugs, But Not Many Puzzles

Considering that Resident Evil 4 follows Leon on a heroic mission to save Ashley, the president's daughter, he doesn't exactly have all that much time to be figuring out puzzles and unlocking doors. As a result, the game is a largely linear experience that clearly leans more into the action genre, though the enemy and weapon variety, paired with the memorable characters and story, still make it one of the most beloved entries in the entire series nonetheless.

With that being said, there are still some small riddles, such as lining up the Insignia symbol when entering Mendez's house, but these are honestly so easy that they can barely be considered puzzles. Capcom would expand upon the puzzles in the remake while also adding a few new ones to try and make it more emblematic of the classics, but those who don't enjoy them will have a much easier experience playing through the original game, which is still well worth trying out even after receiving the remake treatment.

item.title: Genshin Impact Fan Concept Reimagines Ganyu as a Pokemon Trainer
item.description:
Summary

  • A Genshin Impact fans reimagines Ganyu as a Pokemon trainer.
  • As a Cryo user, the fan concept gives Ganyu a Spheal as it is a Water/Ice Pokemon.
  • Ganyu excels as a main DPS or sub-DPS in Genshin Impact, though the Cryo element's weakness hinders her viability in the game.

A talented artist has created an interesting Genshin Impact concept by reimagining Liyue's Cryo user, Ganyu, as a Pokémon trainer. Genshin Impact is known for having a community of fans who, inspired by the game's impressive character designs, often try to create their own projects.

The most popular concept types usually take existing Genshin Impact characters and place them in different environments, including other franchises such as Pokemon . Even though Ganyu is one of the oldest characters on the roster, she still has a sizable player base and is regarded as an S- or A-tier character.

A Reddit user named tsukibun_art has shared an adorable concept in which they've recreated the fan-favorite Ganyu as a Pokemon trainer with a familiar pocket monster by her side. The new concept shows Ganyu wearing a schoolgirl outfit instead of her usual clothes, which fit Liyue's traditional aesthetic. The post gained a lot of attention in the community, reaching over 1.3k upvotes, with many comments praising the design. Choosing Spheal as Ganyu's companion makes sense since Ganyu is a Cryo user in Genshin Impact and Spheal is a Water/Ice Pokemon. Spheal was introduced back in Generation III and can evolve into Sealeo and Walrein. Some fans have pointed out that Genshin Impact should have made the recently introduced Saurians function similarly to Pokemon.

Genshin Impact Fan Creates Pokemon Trainer Concept for Ganyu

As one of the older characters on the roster, Ganyu has become part of Genshin Impact 's Chronicled Wish Banner, which can run alongside the usual limited banner. The most recent Chronicled Wish appeared in January 2025 during Genshin Impact Version 5.3. The introduction of this banner was necessary as the pool of limited five-star characters kept growing with each update, and some playable units went over 500 days without a banner appearance.

Ganyu's best role in most team compositions is main DPS, but she can also be a viable sub-DPS in Genshin Impact since her Elemental Burst stays on the field even if she gets swapped out. However, the core part of her kit is the enhanced Charged Attack, which can deal massive amounts of AoE damage from a long distance. Even though Ganyu was once considered by far the best DPS in the game, the releases of newer and more complex characters have pushed her back in the meta.

Another reason why Ganyu may not be as viable as she used to be is the overall state of the Cryo element in Genshin Impact . For a long time now, Cryo has been considered one of the weakest elements in the game alongside Geo. This is mainly due to the fact that HoYoverse introduced many powerful new elemental reactions with Dendro, none of which interact with Cryo.

item.title: Destiny 2: 13 Best Damage Weapon Choices For The Vesper’s Host Dungeon
item.description:
Summary

  • VS Chill Inhibitor, New Pinnacle Grenade Launcher, offers rapid-fire burst damage & 30% bonus.
  • Lost Signal, an Area Denial Frame, boosts damage rotations with its damage-over-time effect.
  • Grand Overture, Machine Gun with explosive burst damage, ideal for short damage windows.

With the release of Vesper's Host, Destiny 2 proudly boasts a collection of nine dungeons, offering an often challenging experience for players to overcome. Compared to some of Destiny's other dungeons, Vesper's Host sits comfortably among some of the most difficult.

Even outside the level-capped contest mode environment, Vesper's Host can be an unforgiving experience, with many puzzles to solve and enemies to slay. Whether fighting through it with a fireteam, or toughing it out solo, this list has weapon recommendations for all players, old and new.

Updated on March 14, 2025, by Luke Brown: With the release of Episode Heresy, and the balance changes and artifact mods it brought, the damage meta has shifted in favor of linear fusion rifles, as well as Arc and Void weapons. If players are looking for good options for this episode, anything that is able to utilize the Particle Reconstruction artifact mod, or the numerous mods that allow players to use Bolt Charge and Volatile Rounds will thrive in the current climate. Take a look at these examples of damage powerhouses that are sure to make a fine addition to any guardian's arsenal.

13 VS Chill Inhibitor

The New Pinnacle Of Grenade Launchers

  • Available as a random drop from the first two encounters of the Vesper's Host Dungeon
  • Stasis Rapid Fire Heavy Ammo Grenade Launcher
  • God Roll: Envious Arsenal/Cascade Point & Bait And Switch

This list wouldn't be complete without the new king of damage, the VS Chill Inhibitor. Its rapid-fire frame allows for incredible burst damage, helped out even further by Cascade Point, and its large ammo reserves offer impressive total damage outputs. With the 30% damage increase provided by Bait and Switch, this weapon can pump out more consistent damage than any other grenade launcher and do so much faster.

It is perfect for the short damage windows the bosses of Vesper's Host offer the player. The only problem is that a player must complete either of the first two encounters of the Vesper's Host dungeon to get this gun and hope to get lucky with the perks.

12 Lost Signal

An Area Denial Frame That Packs A Punch

  • Available from Episode: Echoes activities and craftable
  • Stasis Area Denial Frame Special Ammo Grenade Launcher
  • God Roll: Auto-Loading Holster/ Lead From Gold & One For All

Unlike many other weapons on this list, Lost Signal is not a damage powerhouse on its own. Where this weapon shines is being incorporated into damage rotations. Fire this weapon, coating the ground (and enemies) in stasis energy, and switch to another one of the weapons from this list to continue damage.

The damage-over-time effect of Lost Signal will not only bolster damage numbers for minimal effort but also help proc perks like Bait and Switch on heavy weapons with relative ease. Both bosses in the Vesper's Host dungeon have several enemies with them, meaning it is easy to activate One For All on Lost Signal for even more passive damage.

11 Witherhoard

The Original Area Denial Frame

  • Purchasable from the Monument to Lost Light in The Tower
  • Kinetic Exotic Special Ammo Grenade Launcher

Witherhoard occupies a similar position to Lost Signal, bolstering the overall damage of a rotation and consistently activating Bait and Switch with ease. Stick Witherhoard's projectile to a boss, or shoot it at the boss' feet to spawn a damaging pool, and switch to a heavy weapon.

While Witherhoard feels somewhat power crept in some instances, it is still well worth using on the final boss of Vesper's Host as the fight requires the player to move frequently, meaning easy-to-use weapons that can do damage without actively firing are perfect choices.

10 Hullabaloo/Dimensional Hypotrochoid

Underappreciated Area Of Effect Damage

  • Hullabaloo was available from Guardian Games 2024, Dimensional Hypotrochoid is available from Neomuna destination activities
  • Arc/Stasis Compressed Wave Frame Heavy Ammo Grenade Launchers
  • God Rolls: Hullabaloo: Envious Assassin & One For All/ Cascade Point. Dimensional Hypotrochoid: Envious Assassin & One For All

Most have largely forgotten the Compressed Wave Frame weapon type. However, it finds a clear use within the first boss encounter in Vesper's Host. Due to the boss consisting of multiple smaller enemies, players can do increased damage by hitting multiple enemies simultaneously.

Hullabaloo and Dimensional Hypotrochoid are perfect in this specific situation because their shots burst across the ground, doing decent damage to any enemies in the way. However, Hullabaloo is currently unavailable, so it might be worth hopping over to Neomuna to grab a Dimensional Hypotrochoid.

9 Grand Overture

A Machine Gun With Explosive Burst Damage

  • Purchasable from the Monument to Lost Light in The Tower
  • Arc Exotic Heavy Machine Gun

Grand Overture is a unique weapon, functioning primarily as a slow-firing machine gun. However, once a player has landed enough shots with it, holding reload will allow them to release a volley of rockets, dealing incredible burst damage very quickly.

Given the short periods in which each boss can be damaged, this gun is a surefire way to take a chunk out of their health bar. Unlike many popular weapons in the heavy slot, Grand Overture requires no support to provide great damage and consistently available ammo.

8 Still Hunt

Golden Gun In Your Pocket

  • Available through a quest in the Pale Heart destination (Requires The Final Shape DLC)
  • Solar Exotic Special Ammo Sniper Rifle

The Still Hunt is a relatively recent addition to the damage weapon roster, released with The Final Shape , but it has taken the community by storm. The weapon charges up by collecting orbs of power and landing precision hits. Once fully charged, the player can hold reload to fire three empowered shots, emulating the hunter's super Golden Gun.

This puts out a lot of damage, especially when paired with the hunter exotic Celestial Nighthawk, which combines all three shots. Whether the player is using Celestial Nighthawk or not, the gun is a powerhouse and works amazingly in damage rotations or on its own.

7 Choir Of One

The One And Only Special Ammo Auto Rifle

  • Available from the Encore exotic mission (craftable with enhanced intrinsic traits and catalysts after multiple completions)
  • Void Special Ammo Auto Rifle

The Choir Of One is a unique weapon, occupying a spot similar to Eriana's Vow in that it should be a primary ammo weapon, yet isn't. This works in its favor, however, giving it an impressive potential damage output while maintaining a decent ammo economy. The Choir Of One can easily tear through ads, helped not only by the Episode Heresy artifact mods but also its catalysts which can give it Subsistance, Onslaught or Destabilizing Rounds, all of which directly feed into its killing potential.

While the perks on this weapon lend it more to clearing rooms full of enemies, its raw damage output allows it to hang with the best of the special ammo damage options, especially when utilizing the artifact perks which allow it to consistently activate Volatile Rounds and Void weaken to make any target melt even faster.

6 Edge Transit

A Fan Favorite That Made A Triumphant Return

  • Available from Onslaught (Attune to Edge Transit with Commander Zavala in The Tower for higher drop rates)
  • Void Adaptive Frame Heavy Ammo Grenade Launcher
  • God Roll: Envious Assassin/ Cascade Point & Bait And Switch

The Edge Transit was once a meme in the Destiny community, but with its return in Into The Light many players were surprised to see it quickly rise to the top of popular damage options. Rolling with the perk Envious Assassin allows the gun to go from 6 shots in the magazine to 18.

Combined with the 30% bonus from Bait And Switch, Edge Transit is easily one of the best options for consistent damage. However, it is only available through the Onslaught activity, meaning it can take some time to get the exact desired perk roll.

5 Bitter/Sweet

A New Staple In Damage Rotations

  • Available from Episode: Revenant activities
  • Arc Adaptive Frame Heavy Grenade Launcher
  • God Roll: Envious Arsenal & Bait And Switch

Bitter/Sweet is one of the new weapons that arrived with Episode: Revenant . The gun occupies a similar role to Edge Transit, except with an arc elemental damage type and the new perk Envious Arsenal rather than Envious Assassin. Envious Arsenal pairs seamlessly with Bait And Switch as both require the player to do damage with their other equipped weapons.

This combo will consistently refill the magazine and offer a 30% damage boost, so as long as ammo reserves are available, all the player needs to do is tag a boss with their other two weapons and lay on the trigger.

4 Dragon's Breath

Solar Synergy Perfected

  • Available from the Monument to Lost Light in The Tower
  • Solar Heavy Ammo Rocket Launcher

Dragon's Breath is possibly the most versatile weapon on this list, boasting the ability to do consistent, high, passive damage to a boss and easily clear a group of enemies. The rocket launcher fires a projectile that sticks wherever it lands and continuously produces solar damaging energy which synergizes with solar subclasses, spreading scorch and ignitions.

Dragon's Breath is great against both bosses in Vesper's Host, the first boss taking huge amounts of damage from the ignitions produced, the final boss benefiting from the ability to shoot a rocket and focus on dodging the incoming attacks without forfeiting damage.

3 Thunderlord

The Easiest Damage Option Out There

  • Available from the Monument to Lost Light in The Tower
  • Arc Heavy Ammo Machine Gun

The Thunderlord has been a fan favorite since its reintroduction into Destiny 2 , and has remained firmly lodged in many players' inventories throughout the various DLC releases since. Able to output an easy, consistent, and surprisingly high level of damage, while also dealing with Overload champions, Thunderlord is a fantastic all-around weapon, the Swiss-army knife of exotic machine guns.

This weapon has found itself a place on this list thanks to its consistency and ease of use, requiring little input from the player other than holding down the trigger and keeping the target in their sights. Paired with the Titan Arc aspect Storm's Keep, this gun can rain lightning down on its targets with its own exotic trait and constantly activate Bolt Charge shockwaves, increasing the already impressive damage output.

2 Whisper Of The Worm

Precise Damage Never Felt Better

  • Available from The Whisper exotic mission (Able to craft with enhanced exotic traits after multiple runs)
  • Solar Heavy Ammo Sniper Rifle

Possibly one of the most famous damage weapons in Destiny's history, the Whisper of the Worm takes the number two spot on this list. By consistently refunding ammo on every third consecutive precision hit, this sniper can pump out mind-blowing amounts of sustained damage, especially once fully crafted and leveled up.

While it may struggle against the first boss of Vesper's Host, if the player can find a safe spot against the final boss, Whisper of the Worm will easily put out more damage than any other option, as long as they hit the boss' crit spot.

1 The Queenbreaker

The Biggest Glow-up The Game Has Ever Seen

  • Available from the Monument to Lost Light in The Tower
  • Arc Heavy Ammo Linear Fusion Rifle

The Queenbreaker went from a weapon that had been gathering dust for several years to a top damage option overnight, thanks to three key changes that launched with Episode Heresy. Firstly, The Queenbreaker was given a rework, the sights are now interchangeable in game by simply holding reload, as well as having enhanced functionalities. Secondly, the introduction of the catalyst for this weapon gave the gun Rewind Rounds, able to consistently refund ammo into the magazine for simply hitting shots. The final factor in this gun's rise to fame was the reintroduction of the Particle Reconstruction perk on the episodic artifact.

Now this weapon is able to pump out unmatched DPS with ease, made even easier by the introduction of a player using Divinity to make those critical hits a breeze. While The Queenbreaker is not advisable as a weapon choice for the first boss of the dungeon, there truly is not better pick for the final boss, if a player is confident in their ability to hit a small crit spot on a constantly moving target.

item.title: Monster Hunter Wilds: Where to Get Sane Decorations
item.description:
The Decoration system is an integral part of bringing your build to the next level in Monster Hunter Wilds . They can ensure you achieve the highest possible levels in a specific skill, making you more potent overall as a hunter.

These skills can vary in what they specifically do and how many possible levels they can have. Some, like the Coalescence skill, can help increase your elemental damage, while others, like Mushroomancer, can provide a surprising level of extra health that can even be branched out for support builds. One particular skill has drawn the eyes of many hunters looking to maximize their damage, which has proven to be useful in numerous builds in Monster Hunter Wilds . That skill is Antivirus , which can be obtained in Decoration form via Sane Decorations . For everything you need to know about Sane Decorations, including what they are and how to find them , look no further than the guide below.

Related
The Sword and Shield is the Best Weapon in Monster Hunter Wilds

I've been using a Long Sword ever since I started Monster Hunter Wilds, but even I would agree that the SnS is the bestweapon in the game simply due to how versatile it is. This weapon type deals excellent damage, and it can do everything that other melee weapons can one way or another. It's simply amazing.

What Are Sane Decorations and How to Get Them in Monster Hunter Wilds

Sane Decorations are a level 1 armor Decoration that, when equipped with a player's gear, can provide 1 level of the Antivirus skill . Antivirus makes it easier to recover from the infamous Frenzy Virus , which then rewards players with an increase in Affinity when cured. Players may find themselves infected with this virus when taking on the returning fan-favorite monster known as Gore Magala . Its entire moveset is about infecting hunters with this virus, making them less deadly in battle if they do not recover from it . However, if a player successfully recovers from it, they get a buff instead .

While this skill may only sound appealing when fighting Gore Magala, this monster's armor can willingly infect players with the Frenzy Virus if they wear enough pieces to get the set bonus. Since fighting off the virus only requires players to consistently attack a target , the negative effect is paid off by its reward being almost instantaneous. This is what makes this specific skill so desirable in many builds.

The Antivirus skill has a total of 3 levels , with its effects being more potent as they go higher. Level 1 armor Decorations are the best way to get there without sacrificing too much of your armor to Gore Magala pieces. The two most consistent ways of getting level 1 Decorations are through quests and melding.

When accepting quests, players will notice jewel-like icons in the rewards bar. These are called Orbs , and they are the main source of obtaining Decorations through every hunt. Each Orb has a classification and distinction of whether it will drop a Decoration for armor or weapons. For the Sane Jewel, be on the lookout for these types of orbs:

  • Mystery Orb - Armor (White jewel icon)
  • Glowing Orb - Armor (Blue jewel icon)
  • Ancient Orb - Armor (Aqua marine jewel icon)

The rewards from these Orbs are determined by random chance , as they pull from all possible Decorations in the game. While this is the fastest way to obtain them without having to spend any resources or materials, remember that luck is a factor in obtaining the Sane Decoration or any specific Decoration by this method.

While these Orbs are always tied to quests, players can also go to the Melding Pot for a more direct approach. The Melding Pot is a vendor found in Suja, Peaks of Accord. Here, players can use almost any materials they have gathered in their travels and exchange them for certain Decorations. Upon discovering the Melding Pot, players can immediately craft level 1 Decorations by exchanging materials or even other owned Decorations. This is direct but can be costly as players can even tap into their monster materials and use them as a means of exchange for Decorations. Therefore, players need to be mindful of what exactly they may offer to ensure they can get their hands on Sane Decorations.
